dialogues.speaker: RAV KRUSHKA
dialogues.text: In the beginning, Hashem made three types of creatures: the angels, the beasts and the human beings. His face lights up speaking about the Torah. RAV KRUSHKA (CONT’D) The angels, He created from His pure word. The angels have no will to do evil, they cannot deviate for one moment from His purpose... The crowd hangs on his every word. RAV KRUSHKA (CONT’D) The beasts have only their instinct to guide them. They too follow the commands of their Maker... The Torah states that Hashem spent almost six whole days of creation fashioning these creatures. Then just before sunset, He took a small quantity of earth and from it He fashioned man-and-woman. An afterthought? Or His crowning achievement? The Rav looks weak, but wants to carry on. RAV KRUSHKA (CONT’D) So, what is this thing, man? Woman? It is a being with the power to disobey. Alone among all the creatures we have free will. His strength is failing him. He’s unable to speak for a f moments. He tries again, more urgently. RAV KRUSHKA (CONT’D) We hang suspended between two certainties: the clarity of the angels and the desires of the beasts. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAV KRUSHKA (CONT’D) Hashem gave us Choice which is both a privilege and a burden: we must then Choose the tangled life we live. 1A.  2. The Rav closes his eyes for a moment. When he opens them, stares at the crowd, blankly. He can’t continue. Dovid takes the Rav’s arm and starts leading him back to seat. The Rav stops, mumbles something in Yiddish about n being able to see very clearly... And collapses. An instant of stunned silence, then several MEN rush over the body.

They cover the Rav's head and clothe him. The Chevra Kadisha surround the Rav's body and ask his forgiveness. They put the body into a coffin and nail the lid down wit two wooden sticks.

dialogues.text: No..

dialogues.text: +. May you live a long life. Ronit looks at him, hurt, imploring. She moves forward to him but he draw back. He cannot touch her, these are the rules. Ronit sees this, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: It’s probably some twelve year old reporter. Forget about it. Ronit feels vulnerable, all this talk of her father and s is not really involved in any of it.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Everybody loves him so much. I used to wonder if I loved him as much as all those strangers did. Or sometimes if I loved him at all.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: You're his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: He was always closer to you.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: .-He enjoyed teaching me.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I used to wonder how the two of you could talk together for so long.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: He'd talk and I'd listen. Mostly about the Torah..Try to get some sleep Ronit. Esti comes in and puts some hangers in the wardrobe, a to on her arm. Dovid loiters, waiting for her to finish the and they can both go. Esti puts the towel on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thanks.. Dovid.. She goes to her suitcase and looks for something. Takes o an art catalogue of her photographs. She gives it to Dovi

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I brought this for you.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Your pictures. Wonderful.. Esti waits at the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you Ronit. Good night.  28

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: So are you two well? Is it good?.. being married? .. Dovid hesitates, nods.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: We're very happy. Dovid and Esti exit. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. DINING ROOM. NIGHT. 28 Esti goes to a covered mirror and takes the drape off it. catches sight of herself for a moment, worried. Then she towards the kitchen. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. KITCHEN. NIGHT. 28A Esti goes to the sink and turns on the tap. She takes a g from the draining board and she’s surprised to see -- her hands are shaking. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. DOVID & ESTI’S BEDROOM. DAY. 2 Esti sits on her bed, already dressed, her wig on. She watches Dovid who wakes up. He almost immediately starts say a morning blessing. He looks beautiful,half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Modeh Ani Lefanecha, Melech Chai Vekayam, Shehechezarta Bi Nishmati, Bechemla, Raba Emunatecha. Esti crosses to him. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. KITCHEN. DAY. 30 Esti and Dovid sit at the table after breakfast, having t Esti turns the pages of Ronit’s monogram, they are photographic portraits of twins.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Have you looked at these?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: No.  21A. Ronit appears at the bottom of the stairs, still in her pyjamas.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Morning Ronit.. Did you sleep?  22. Ronit comes and sits with them at the table, restless. Es pours her a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Not really. Ronit drinks her tea.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: What will you do today? Do you want us to show you the new wing of the shul?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I’m fine. I want to have a wander round the old places. A pause, “their old places.” Esti sorts her bag for schoo

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (TO DOVID)
dialogues.text: You’ve read Othello haven’t you? Mrs. Shapiro wants your approval on my teaching it. Ronit looks at them. She is totally floored by the need f the husband’s compliance.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: It’s a great play. Why wouldn’t you teach it?..Where will you go Ronit?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I’ll go to Greenbergs and eat cakes. Sit at our table... Where we all planned our escape together.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Your pictures are very beautiful Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Do you have a dark room?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’ve sectioned part of the room off.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Do you remember my grandfather’s dark room? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Under the stairs with the red light and the pictures gradually coming out. I liked the smell in there..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: It was always very warm..we got high on the developing fluid.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you did that. Esti looks at the cover, ”“ Identical ; by Ronnie Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Is Curtis your married name?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No. I’m single.. Mrs. Kuperman. Ronit smiles at Esti, tries to make light of things, to pretend everything is normal.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Will you have some breakfast? Ronit seems nervous about something she has to say.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thank you both.. for... They both look at Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For taking care of my father. Dovid is upset by the thought of the Rav ill. He tries to control his emotion.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: The Rav took care of me. Many times... I have to go. Are you ready Esti?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I’ll be there in a minute. Dovid gets up, leaving Esti and Ronit awkward. Ronit and sit in silence for some moments.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dovid has been incredibly upset. Ronit is irritated by this.  31 32 24.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Do you really have to get permission from your husband? To teach a play?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Don’t Ronit...

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: It’s just a question.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: It’s not what you’re asking. It’s the way you ask it.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I’m just amazed..It’s a classic text? It’s not porn.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I have to go. Esti looks at Ronit and gets up, she puts some spare keys next to Ronit and takes her handbag. E/I. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE/ DOVID’S CAR. DAY. 31 Dovid starts the car as Esti comes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Esti nods. They drive away. EXT. GIRLS’ SCHOOL. DAY. 32 MOTHERS are walking their DAUGHTERS into school, the girl are in uniform. Dovid stops outside the GIRLS' SCHOOL and Esti gets out o the car. She waves goodbye and heads toward the building. SECURITY GUARDS stand outside. Several GIRLS, 12ish, with their mothers wave at Esti. One GIRL, RINA, 12, waves adamantly, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RINA
dialogues.text: Good morning Mrs. Kuperman!  24a. 33 INT. GIRLS’ SCHOOL. CORRIDOR. DAY. 33 Esti and the imposing MRS. HANNAH SHAPIRO (50s), the headmistress, walk towards Esti’s classroom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHAPIRO
dialogues.text: Miss Scheinberg has been very capable. I worried as she’s never had a class of her own but no..

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Good.. I appreciated the time off. Thank you.  34 25. At the classroom Mrs. Shapiro walks on. Esti stops outsid it, TEENAGE GIRLS are inside. They are singing the mornin prayer. They kiss their prayer books and then they sit do Esti looks in closer through the door window and sees -- The substitute teacher, MISS SCHEINBERG (20s), attractive hopeful, stands at the whiteboard at front. Esti stares at Miss Scheinberg, the young woman that she to resemble. Esti knocks and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Scheinberg and the GIRLS turn to see Esti walk in. T girls stand up. They are bright and pleased to see Esti.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Good morning, girls!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mrs. Kuperman! Esti crosses to Miss Scheinberg.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Thank you. For covering for me.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCHITZLER
dialogues.text: It was a pleasure. Your class is very bright.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Have you done me proud girls? The girls smile back at her.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘ll take over now.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCHITZLER
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: ( to the girls) I missed you!

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: We missed you too Mrs. Kuperman!  35 36 26. Miss Scheinberg crosses to her. Esti walks to the whiteboard. She smiles but she is troubled. EXT. RIVKAH’S COUNCIL BLOCK. HENDON. DAY. 35 Dovid waits at a door of a large council house block. He rings (again)... He hears steps on the stairs. RIVKAH, ( opens the door, with a baby in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: Sorry.. Sorry.. The children!

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Hello Rivkah.. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: Better, much better thanks. INT. RIVKAH’S FLAT. A FRONT ROOM. HENDON. DAY. 36 RIVKAH and AVI ( 30s) and Dovid sit around a coffee table SHMULI (6) sits on the couch in a blanket in his pyjamas. has a cold. One of a set of TWINS, a redhead, one year ol is held by Rivkah, the other is in a Moses basket near to them, also a redhead, and sleeps. There is a brown envelo on the table.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Thank you Dovid. I’1l get it back to all of you, it was just impossible you know, with Rivkah being so ill?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: It’s not a loan. It’s from everyone....And you have the all clear now yes?

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: I do.. I go for a check up every six months from now on.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Wonderful..that’s great... And you've got the day off school Shmuli? Shmuli nods, happy.  27.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: He didn’t sleep. He’s got a cold.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Are you going to help your mother instead?

dialogues.speaker: SHMULI
dialogues.text: No. Shmuli smiles, naughty and easy with Dovid.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: I saw they’ve started extending the eruv?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Yes. By a few miles.

dialogues.speaker: SHMULI
dialogues.text: What’s an eruv?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Come here. Dovid indicates for Shmuli to come up into his arms. He l him up and takes him to the window. They are familiar, Sh trusts him.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see the line over there in the sky? Between the poles? Shmuli nods.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the eruv.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: It’s like a big circle around where we live.  37 28.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: It’s not an exact circle.

dialogues.speaker: SHMULI
dialogues.text: Where’s the rest of it?

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: It’s all around us... You know how before we couldn’t push the twins in their buggy on Shabbos outside? And dad couldn’t carry his keys in the street? Shmuli nods.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we can. Because the circle is bigger and it becomes like your house.

dialogues.speaker: SHMULI
dialogues.text: Can we go outside it?

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: You don’t need to. We have everything we need inside of it.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: You should go outside of it Shmuli, when you’re older. Then you’1l know if you want to stay inside. Avi disagrees, but lets it go. Dovid puts Shmuli back dow and Rivkah tickles him. Shmuli laughs and struggles.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Be careful of your mother eh, careful! No jumping on her! Avi shakes his head, smiles, the family is well, thankful Dovid watches them all, he aches for a family. I/E. DOVID’S CAR/ SYNAGOGUE. DAY. 37 Dovid parks outside the synagogue. He gets out and walks to the temple.  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dovid walks down a corridor, where a few MEN go about the business.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSCHBAUM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dovid! Dovid turns. YOSEF KIRSCHBAUM (60s) and DR. GIDEON RIGLER (50s) come up to him and shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Good morning, Yosef. Dr. Rigler.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RIGLER
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSCHBAUM
dialogues.text: How are you, Dovid? Dovid nods, smiling. KIRSCHBAUM (CONT’D) How is your speech coming along? It will be a wonderful Hesped.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RIGLER
dialogues.text: The Rav would be very proud of you Dovid.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: It will be hard to do justice to his life and work.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSCHBAUM
dialogues.text: Ronit Krushka is staying with you?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Yes, she is. Kirschbaum and Dr. Rigler nod, unsure. Dovid smiles and h starts walking again, more tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dovid leads a study group with GAVRIEL, LEVI and AKIVA, t rabbinical newly married students, all in their 20s. They have open books before them.  30.

dialogues.speaker: GAVRIEL
dialogues.text: “Ud-she’ha’melech bim’siboy nir’di nosson reichoy.”

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: OK stop there. So what does it mean? Give us the translation - in English.

dialogues.speaker: GAVRIEL
dialogues.text: “While the king is at his table, my perfume sends forth its fragrance.”

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Yes - “A bundle of myrrh is my beloved to me, that lies all night between my breasts. My beloved is to me as a cluster of henna blooms in the vineyards of Ein-Gedi.” Dovid stops, sits back and motions to the others to comme

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nu?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Rashi makes the point...

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: No - let’s not think about Rashi’s commentaries for a moment.. What do YOU think? The students look at him, a touch shocked.

dialogues.speaker: GAVRIEL
dialogues.text: Is it that.. is it about Hashem and Israel?

dialogues.speaker: AKIVA
dialogues.text: Or is it about sensuality?.. That is the way in which true love manifests itself?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: But might it also mean that between a male and a female there is something higher than that.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No. The references to sensual pleasures celebrate physical love here. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The enjoyment of that love becomes, in this context, the highest.

dialogues.speaker: GAVRIEL
dialogues.text: Perhaps.. but that is a limited view. There are many different forms of love.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: “See, you are fair, my love, you are fair; your eyes are doves.”  40 4l 31. Dovid suddenly looks very tired. He takes off his glasses closes his eyes. Pinches the bridge of his nose.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “See, you are handsome, my beloved, yea, pleasing; and our bed is verdant. The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters...” Dovid stops.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (puts on his glasses) Continue to read the commentaries to yourselves. They look back to their books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronit walks. She crosses the street towards the.. EXT. CEMETERY. RAV’S GRAVE. DAY 4l Ronit walks through the rows of gravestones. Makes an eff to connect. She sees, from a distance -- Four ORTHODOX TEENAGERS dressed in black with black hats, standing before a new grave: a mound of dirt. The TEENAGE each hold a prayer book. Ronit moves closer. It’s the Rav’s grave, a mound of eart  42 43 44 32. Ronit waits for the teenagers to leave. But they don’t mo Ronit looks around at the headstones.. Finally, she loses patience. She approaches the Rav’s grave. The teenagers watch her, with surprise and desire. Ronit gets to the grave and tries to focus on her farewel Ronit stares at the teenagers, they look down, but they d leave. Ronit looks at the grave, again tries to calm herself... the boys are still staring.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (IN YIDDISH)
dialogues.text: That’s my dad. The Teenagers nod and shuffle off, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good morning, Tatti.. Ronit looks at the earth mound and leaves, upset. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. DOVID & ESTI’S BEDROOM. DAY. 4 Dovid unbuttons his shirt. He is in his trousers, his bod fit and attractive. Esti lies down on the beds which are pulled together. She has underwear on and pulls a cover o her. Dovid sits on the side of the bed and he takes Esti’ hand which is waiting to take his. Now he takes away the cover from Esti and kisses her. Esti cradles his head and kisses him, affectionate but not passionate. INT. GREENBERGS’ BAKERY AND CAFE. DAY. 43 Ronit points to a particular pastry that she has been ach for. dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Yes. Just one... And an apple strudel thanks. EXT. GREENBERGS’ BAKERY AND CAFE. DAY 44 Outside the shop Jewish and non Jewish folk hurry about, stressed. Dovid and Esti turn to look at h Dovid is surprised by her outfit and smiles, shaking his head. Esti seems distanced from them both.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: What? Is it too much? It’s only Uncle Hartog.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: It’s the Goldfarbs too. Rabbi and Rebbetzin Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: And he still invited me?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: I've invited you. Esti picks up the ornate Shabbos matchbox and lights a candle. Esti waves her hands over the flames three times brings her hands to her eyes, praying. Dovid watches, Ron mouths the familiar words and feels the rhythm of the pra

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: «Vv'Shabat kad'sh'kha b'ahavah uv'ratzon hin'chal'tanu Barukh atah Adonai m'kadeish hashabat.

dialogues.text: Amen. Hartog pours wine into seven small glasses. He sits down, drinks from one glass, he passes a second to Rabbi Goldfa Dovid looks at Esti and Ronit, across the table. dialogues.speaker: GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: So our youngest one Basha, she has just had her second boy. And they named him Daniel, for my father. Goldfarb smiles.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: They live in Australia. Too far. Melbourne. Thirty seven grandchildren!

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: We saw your photos in a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Your pictures of the twins.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: But they called you Ronnie Curtis? What was wrong with your real name, Krushka? You should be proud of it.  35.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: Artists change their names, don’t they Moshe?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Women change their names every day. They take their husband’s name and their own history is gone. Everyone looks at Esti, unsure, as she has said it gently Everybody is silent.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? They do, don’t they? Fruma stares at Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: You look so much like your mother. You have Leah’s eyes, don’t you think Moshe? Everyone looks at Ronit.. She smiles. Hartog looks at her nods, affected...

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFARB, (TO HARTOG)
dialogues.text: Your dear sister was taken too soon... And now the Rav.. This must all be such a shock to you Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: You're away it’s a shock. Of course it is! We never thought we’d see you again.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to disappoint you...

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: Ronit.. More coffee?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No thanks. I need to sort the house while I’m over here.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: Nisht Shabbos garecht...Come to the office and we'll talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: You must take Leah’s candlesticks Ronit. From the house.  35A.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: Yes of course. And then you must give them to your children. They wait.. Ronit says nothing, stifled by the talk of children whilst saddened by the thought of her mother. Sh half nods, feeling awkward.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: Ronit? They must be passed on through the mother’s side.. to carry on the bloodline.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Perhaps Ronit doesn’t want to have children.. Everyone looks at Esti, how could anyone not want them? E looks down.  36.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (TO HARTOG)
dialogues.text: ..-Can you help me sell the house? Hartog puts his finger to his lips, quiet! Ronit obeys.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: How old were you Dovid when the Rav took you in? And taught you? Thirteen was it? Dovid nods.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFARB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dovid has been doing great work in the community.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: There have been a lot of problems. With housing. And jobs.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: The youth... Even one incident of drugs.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: Nothing that we cannot deal with. Hashem protects us.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Perhaps people should stop having such huge families. Hartog is becoming quietly furious with Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: And you're not married yet? You must find someone Ronit. It’s not funny growing old alone.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I have good friends.

dialogues.speaker: REBBETZIN GOLDFARB
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sure you have lots of fun. But that will pass. Being married.. Well, it’s the way it should be. Her words hit a mark with Ronit, who is quietly in pain amongst all the couples.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Is it? Or is it just institutional obligation?  36A.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: Ronit.. Stop right there. Yes? Ronit approaches it as an academic problem, not an emotio one.  49 37.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: If I hadn’t left here when I did.. If I’d stayed a year longer I'd have been married off to whoever... Give it ten years in some loveless marriage and I might have killed myself. Or at least felt like doing it. Esti looks down, she is upset. Ronit sees this.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.. I should go.

dialogues.speaker: FRUMA
dialogues.text: Ronit? Ronit gets up.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Thank you Fruma.. Sorry.. That was.. lovely. Ronit gets up and leaves. There is an awkward silence. Do stands.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: I’'1l walk Ronit back to ours. Esti?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: You go on. I’1l get my coat. Esti looks at him, then down. EXT. HARTOG’S HOUSE. STREET. NIGHT 49 Dovid catches up with Ronit who is leaving the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Ronit.. Ronit looks back, slows a touch for Dovid to join her.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Happy Shabbos...  50 38. They walk in time. Ronit smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why is Rebbetzin Goldfarb so angry? She has a good life. What else does she want?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: What do any of us want?.. Do you know what you really want? Ronit shakes her head, they walk on quietly. Ronit stops she wants to cry and tries to stop herself.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I do. I know what I want. Dovid stops with her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (GENTLY)
dialogues.text: Ronit? What is it you want? Ronit nods but cannot trust herself to say anything witho crying.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What is it Ronit?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: My dad.. My dad...I want him to know that I loved him... Do you think he knew that?

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes he did. He had to know that. Ronit looks at him, lost. Dovid wants to hold her but is allowed to. He places his hands near to her arms as if to suggest holding her.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Ronit. The Rav was.. You’ve lost your father. Ronit wants comfort from him and sees behind Dovid that E is standing in the street outside Hartog’s house, watchin them. EXT. WIGMAKER’S SHOP. HENDON. DAY. 50 Ronit arrives at a large wigmaker's shop. She goes in.  51 39. INT. WIGMAKER’S SHOP. HENDON. DAY 51 Endless rows of mannequin heads sporting all kinds of hairstyles and sensible colors and cuts. A FEMALE ASSISTA 60s, helps another WOMAN, 50s, to find a wig. The Assista looks at Ronit as she comes in. Both older women are very aware of Ronit being an Outsider.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I need to speak to my uncle, Mr. Hartog.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: One moment. The Assistant slowly crosses to the door to Hartog’s offi Ronit looks at the various wigs, they’re awful. She tries on, it’s terrible, she takes it off. The Assistant comes in and holds up two fingers gently. ASSISTANT (CONT’D) Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thanks. The Assistant goes back to helping the Woman try her wig Ronit can feel their disapproval and looks; she picks up nicer dark bob wig.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: I can help you in a minute if you’d like to wait?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No no I’m fine.. Thanks. Ronit puts it on, it looks very French new wave. A dark curtain behind a window flicks and Hartog looks through t the shop. He holds a mobile and nods at Ronit, indicates her to wait. Ronit waits for a few moments then a knock i heard on the door from the office, Hartog’s indication to assistant.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: He’s ready for you now. Ronit walks into the office, bewigged.  52 40. INT. WIGMAKER’S SHOP. OFFICE. DAY 52 Hartog shows Ronit into a small office with cabinet files stacks of papers, posters of wigs. A desk facing two chai

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: Have a seat, please. Ronit? Indicating her to take the wig off, but she doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: So.. They sit. He takes his time.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How is life.. are you making a living with your photos? Ronit is a bit thrown by his questions.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I get by.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: You broke the Rav’s heart when you left. Ronit tries to stay strong.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: He told me to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: For Israel yes. Not for New York. He gave you the ticket, the funds. Ronit finds this all too hard.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Can we talk about the house?

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: It was very hard for him. Your disappearing like that... Hartog pushes a bunch of yale keys towards her.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are the keys for you to gather any personal possessions.  40A.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Thanks. Can you help me to sell it?  41. Ronit takes the set of keys with various key label fobs o them. Hartog opens a drawer. He looks through some papers grabs a folder. He takes out a document and hands it to Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: So.. you would want to honour your family Ronit? ..clause three.. read it. Ronit looks at the small print but does not read it.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rav Krushka, bless his memory, left the house and everything in it to the synagogue... Ronit makes an effort to appear strong.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: I’m sorry if that’s a shock.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No. No it’s not. It’s just.. A house. Ronit prepares to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: A father should have a child to look after him in his final hours.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: But I didn’t know he was ill.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: How could you know when you are not here? Ronit endeavours not to cry, to be clear.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your mother.. My sister.. She was a wonderful woman Ronit.. a very loyal person. When Leah died Shlomo grieved deeply for her.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I don’t remember a time when he wasn’t grieving for her.  53 42.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: You were all he had left.... it must be very painful for you.. Not to receive the Rav’s forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: You're a monster Moshe. All you see is your own righteousness but you .-hurt and you hurt. Ronit stands up, sad, furious. She has forgotten she is e wearing the wig. She is enveloped by sadness about her father’s further rejection of her.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG
dialogues.text: Ronit? He indicates the wig but Ronit starts to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: HARTOG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The wig! But she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esti walks down an aisle with a shopping cart. She stops in front of the canned tomatoes, conflicted. Li Shmuli comes towards her, carrying a basket.

dialogues.speaker: SHMULI
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mrs. Kuperman! Esti turns around to see him.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Hello, Shmuli! RIVKAH (30s) comes down the aisle pushing a double buggy.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rivkah, you look great. How are you all?

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH
dialogues.text: We're good. And all the help Esti, it was very appreciated. One of the redhead twins starts to cry inside the buggy.  54 43.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no, she'll wake up her sister. Rivkah lifts the cover, revealing the twins. She picks up one that’s crying, starts to rock her -- too late. Her sister wakes up and starts crying too. Esti looks on some distance. But Rivkah puts one of the twins in Esti’s arms so she’s free to pick up the other one. Instinct takes over as Esti holds the child and starts to rock her. Much to her surprise, the baby stops crying. Sh looks at Esti with her big baby eyes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s Shayna.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: (coos) Hey there, Shayna...

dialogues.speaker: RIVKAH, (WARM)
dialogues.text: I saw Ronit just now. She hasn’t changed, has she?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No.. No she hasn’t. Rivkah returns one baby to the buggy. Esti reluctantly returns Shayna to Rivkah.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Hello.. Esti approaches Ronit.  55 56 57

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: (smiles) Are you wearing a wig? Ronit takes it off. Puts it in her bag. EXT. RAV’S HOUSE. DAY 55 Esti and Ronit get to the Rav’s deserted-looking house. dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Ronit! Not near that..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I wasn’t going to!.. Ronit doesn’t know if she was about to light up in her distraction.. But she puts her cigarettes away. dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: You should take these. Your mother’s candlesticks. Ronit looks at them and the picture of her mother.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: --I can’t. Ronit walks away. INT. RAV’S HOUSE. DINING ROOM. DAY 59 Ronit looks through the jumbled room, overwhelmed. Esti accompanies her. There is a battery radio. Ronit tries it hears static. She finds some gangsta rap music and plays as loud as she can, which is not very loud. Her rebellion a touch feeble.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: He left it all to the synagogue.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Would you really want it?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Financial freedom? Of course not. That would be far too easy... I would have liked him to remember me though, in his will. Just to have left me a pipe.. to have named me. Ronit looks at the masses of stuff, Esti watches her. Ron turns off the radio. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: My room.. INT. RAV’S HOUSE. UPSTAIRS. STUDY. DAY. 61 The Study has more order than the other rooms. Endless ro of impeccable leather bound books in Hebrew. Silence. On the table she finds the Rav’s pipe stand, tin of tobacco, and a book. She picks it up, turns a few pages. Enjoys it.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: That’s all he did..stay in here all day with the Torah. And the commentaries on the Torah. And the notes on the commentaries, and the debates on the notes...

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: It meant that we could do what we wanted. Ronit smiles, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: «Do you think I should go back early? Ronit really looks at Esti and for the first time Esti do not avoid her gaze. dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No. No I don’t think you should leave at all. Ronit..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Esti..? ..When I saw you.. My heart..

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I know..  62 63 47. Esti wants to cry. They are full of each other. Ronit and Esti breathe in this touch. Esti rocks for a moment with Ronit then kisses her. Boldly. Ronit kisses her back for moments. They hold each other. Then Ronit backs off.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No..

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Why? Why not? Ronit turns away. She walks out of the room. Esti takes a moment to recompose herself. Then she follows. INT. RAV’S HOUSE. HALLWAY. DAY. 62 Ronit walks down the stairs and Esti follows. At the door Ronit looks around at the dark hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Ronit..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Ronit waits for Esti, ready for something to happen. But Esti reaches her they look at each other. Ronit starts to open the door to go. Esti slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No! You don’t just walk out! Not again! I waited Ronit! I waited such a long time! They stare at each other. Esti holds Ronit’s face. Ronit Esti kiss hard and fast and passionate for a while. But a Ronit pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-Ronit. Ronit walks out. Esti glances at the candlesticks and at Ronit walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronit and Esti walk down a street. Ronit studies Esti, Ro is beyond confused.  48.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: .-It was me who rang the shul in New York. To let you know. Ronit stops and looks at her. Esti is self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was the right thing to do. A couple of JEWISH MEN pass by on the sidewalk opposite; and Ronit try to act normal. They keep walking. Esti’s wheelie shopping bag is a bit awkward to wheel.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Why did you get married Esti? Why didn’t you just leave?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Do you remember what the Rav used to say about marriage?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: You do.. Ronit almost smiles, remembering..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: «-“Will you grow old by yourself?”

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No no.. “Vill you grow old alone, vith no family, no joys?” Ronit remembers and almost laughs. Esti continues with th game.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Dovid is a good boy, he has a generous heart, and he's crazy about you. Marry him!” It hurts Esti to recollect the simplicity of it.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: So you were.. alright... After I left?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No. I was.. ill..  48A.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: What sort of ill?  Esti shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: In my head.. The Rav was afraid for me.. and if I was going to have to sleep with a man why not with our best friend?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Esti..

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I think he felt marriage would “cure” me... And it hasn’t been a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: And that’s Enough? ..Do you have to have sex every Friday?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: It’s expected.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: It’s medieval.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: It’s not mandatory. Nobody gets beaten if they don’t feel like it. Ronit really looks at Esti now.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? ..

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: What Happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Nothing..You happened to me.. And then I started teaching and .. That became important.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: You can teach anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I really love the girls. And I give them ambition.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: To do what? Have seven babies and be a great wife?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Don’t... I’m a good teacher. I help them. To value themselves.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: But what about You?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: -. That is me.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Do you want a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No. And you? Are you happy? Ronit nods.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I am. Esti’s happily not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Have you been with other women?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Not really.. and you? Esti shakes her head. She takes Ronit’s cigarette and sto to take one puff of it. Esti loves the cigarette puff and this makes Ronit smile. She passes it back to Ronit and t start walking again. Ronit laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Your bag. It’s deeply erotic. Esti shakes her head, smiles. This is all madness.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me take it.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No. You’re not frum. You don’t get one.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Please?  64 51.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: No.. Okay, you can have a turn. Ronit takes the wheelie bag, Esti takes Ronit’s cigarette they walk on.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: And children?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: I have three. In the bag. All redheads... It didn’t happen... Everyone prayed for us. The Wives all think Dovid’s wasted himself on a barren woman.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: They don’t.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: They do. They lust for him.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: But do you want to have children?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Yes. Desperately. But then sometimes I think I willed it this way. The air here is maybe too thin. For me. For a child. They get to the edge of the park and go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronit and Esti walk through the deserted park. They stop under a white tree.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I used to love this park...

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: It’s insane that you're here. We're here. Esti laughs.. Ronit is surprised to be suddenly so moved Esti. They hold hands as they walk but Esti is cautious.  65 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronit looks over at the old tennis court. Esti walks towa the gate of the court and looks back at Ronit who follows her. Esti goes into and behind the steel gate and parks h wheelie bag. Ronit follows her. Esti stands against a bri wall. They look at each other for a moment. The air is heighten for them -- they kiss again, in the half light, against t wall, long and passionate. Then a flickering light. They look like they are in a sil movie. Ronit and Esti break away from each other to see w the light is happening. Standing fifteen yards away, staring at them -- a couple, Hinda and her husband, LEV (40s). Hinda wears a long skir and holds a tennis racquet. Lev holds a racquet too.

dialogues.speaker: HINDA
dialogues.text: Ronit? Is that you? Esti turns white and turns away from Hinda. They’re not s how much the couple saw. Esti turns and disappears down a path and past a building.

dialogues.speaker: HINDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here? The light comes on and bright now. Hinda and Lev start walking towards Ronit, who stands there, not knowing what do.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I'm just.. seeing the old places.

dialogues.speaker: HINDA
dialogues.text: This is my husband, Lev. This is Ronit, the Rav’s daughter. Remember I told you all about her? Lev stares at Ronit sternly. Ronit shields her eyes from bright light.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Hi Lev. How’s it going? Lev is obviously resentful of her presence.

dialogues.speaker: LEV
dialogues.text: I hear that you’re attending the Hesped. The Rav was a truly great man.  53. Lev’s coldness infuriates Ronit.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: I know. I was his daughter. Would you like a cigarette? They both shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: HINDA
dialogues.text: Was that Rebbetzin Kuperman?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: HINDA
dialogues.text: Whose shopping is that? Ronit looks at the wheelie bag.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Mine. A few seconds of tense silence. No one knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well.. Have a good match.

dialogues.speaker: HINDA
dialogues.text: It’s really good to see you. Really good. So good. More silence... No one moves. Lev is still glaring at Ron The tension won’t subside.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Can I? Ronit indicates Hinda’s racquet which she gives to her. R takes a ball from Lev. Ronit bounces it a bit then serves amazing thwack of an ace to the other side. Ronit takes o her wig from her bag and gives it to a puzzled Hinda. Ron leaves, lighting up a cigarette as she goes. She even man to look good trailing the wheelie bag, New Yorkish. 66 EXT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. BATHROOM. NIGHT 68A The shower is running and Esti is in it but we do not rea see her, it is shower curtain and steam. A knock at the d

dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Esti, is that you? Are you alright? Esti tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m fine. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. LANDING/BATHROOM. NIGHT 69 Dovid waits outside the bathroom door.

dialogues.text: Esti? The shower stops.

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’ll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: DOVID
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ESTI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who? What? Dovid opens the door a little.

dialogues.text: You ran into the house like you were being chased? Esti is about to step out of the shower, nude, dripping w She stares at Dovid defiantly. Dovid looks at her. Feels his intrusion. dialogues.speaker: DOVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dry yourself. You’1ll get ill. He hands her a towel.

dialogues.text: Ronit crosses an avenue with Esti’s wheelie bag, heads fo bar.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAN
dialogues.text: What will it be?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: A pint of lager... No.. a double vodka and tonic.

dialogues.text: Ice and lemon?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: Shit.. sorry. A small lamp is on underneath Dovid and Esti’s door. Roni walks slowly, but the floorboards CREAK. She walks up to Esti’s door and listens. INT. DOVID & ESTI’S HOUSE. dialogues.text: Ronit? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: RONIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Sorry I.. Walked into the books.

dialogues.text: What’s happened? .. Esti? Esti walks beside her, gathers herself.

dialogues.text: Yesterday ...I behaved like an adolescent.

dialogues.speaker: RONIT
dialogues.text: What?  60.

dialogues.text: Tell me.. What did they say? They get to a corner, wait for a car to pass. Ronit looks Esti -- her outfit, her headscarf, her neck. She feels mo and attracted. But also Ronit feels a touch foolish and exposed.

dialogues.text: Ronit.. Please...I can’t do this.

dialogues.text: Esti....

dialogues.text: I used to think about you in New York...with your new friends.. I tried to imagine your room..Or us on the subway...I wrote the time zones down and the hours so I knew what time you were awake and asleep.

dialogues.text: Don't. Ronit doesn’t want to think about him. She lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.text: .-What? Ronit smiles, she is happy. There is a serenity in Esti t wasn’t there before and makes her incredibly attractive. Ronit sees it. She touches Esti’s skin.
